Class Pipe

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      Pipe
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Pipe
extends Thread

Drains an input stream to an output stream. Upon construction, starts a new thread that starts draining data from an input stream and writing it to an output stream. Features timeout, maximum bytes transferred, auto-close in/out, and transfer buffer size control. TODO

  • Write tests

private int _timeout
The maximum number of milliseconds for this operation to take. -1 == not timeout

The size of the buffer to use. This is the maxmimum (and attempted) read size.

Constructor Detail

Pipe

public Pipe(InputStream in,
            OutputStream out)
Creates a default Pipe. No Timeout. No maxmimum number of bytes to move. Use the default buffer size. Do not close input when done. Do not close output when done.

Parameters:
in - The input stream to read from
out - The output stream to send the data to

Pipe

public Pipe(InputStream in,
            OutputStream out,
            boolean closeInWhenDone,
            boolean closeOutWhenDone)
Creates a Pipe, optionally closing the input, the output or both. No Timeout. No maxmimum number of bytes to move. Use the default buffer size.

Parameters:
in - The input stream to read from
out - The output stream to send the data to
closeInWhenDone - If true, in will have close() called in it when done.
closeOutWhenDone - If true, out will have close() called in it when done.

Pipe

public Pipe(InputStream in,
            OutputStream out,
            int timeoutInMilliseconds,
            int bufferSize,
            int maxBytes)
Creates a Pipe, optionally closing the input, the output or both. Do not close input when done. Do not close output when done.

Parameters:
in - The input stream to read from
out - The output stream to send the data to
timeoutInMilliseconds - The number of milliseconds to wait for data from in before ending the pipe
bufferSize - The number of bytes to attempt to read at a time
maxBytes - The maximum number of bytes to transfer fron in to out

Pipe

public Pipe(InputStream in,
            OutputStream out,
            int timeoutInMilliseconds,
            boolean closeInWhenDone,
            boolean closeOutWhenDone)
Creates a Pipe, optionally closing the input, the output or both. No maxmimum number of bytes to move. Use the default buffer size.

Parameters:
in - The input stream to read from
out - The output stream to send the data to
timeoutInMilliseconds - The number of milliseconds to wait for data from in before ending the pipe
closeInWhenDone - If true, in will have close() called in it when done.
closeOutWhenDone - If true, out will have close() called in it when done.

Pipe

public Pipe(InputStream in,
            OutputStream out,
            int timeoutInMilliseconds,
            int bufferSize,
            int maxBytes,
            boolean closeInWhenDone,
            boolean closeOutWhenDone)
Creates a Pipe, optionally closing the input, the output or both.

Parameters:
in - The input stream to read from
out - The output stream to send the data to
timeoutInMilliseconds - The number of milliseconds to wait for data from in before ending the pipe
bufferSize - The number of bytes to attempt to read at a time
maxBytes - The maximum number of bytes to transfer fron in to out
closeInWhenDone - If true, in will have close() called in it when done.
closeOutWhenDone - If true, out will have close() called in it when done.
Method Detail

terminate

public void terminate()
Tell the copy thread to stop the copying.

exception

Exception exception()
Reports the exception (if any) that stopped the copy.

Returns:
The exception or null if none has occurred.

running

boolean running()
Determines if the copy is still under way.

Returns:
true if we are still copying from in to out.

run

public void run()
Thread entry point. Does all the copying.

Specified by:
run in interface Runnable
Overrides:
run in class Thread

_init

private void _init(InputStream in,
                   OutputStream out,
                   int timeoutInMilliseconds,
                   int bufferSize,
                   int maxBytes,
                   boolean closeInWhenDone,
                   boolean closeOutWhenDone)
Initialize this Pipe. Shared code for the constructors.

Parameters:
in - The input stream to read from
out - The output stream to send the data to
timeoutInMilliseconds - The number of milliseconds to wait for data from in before ending the pipe
bufferSize - The number of bytes to attempt to read at a time
maxBytes - The maximum number of bytes to transfer fron in to out
closeInWhenDone - If true, in will have close() called in it when done.
closeOutWhenDone - If true, out will have close() called in it when done.
